intro: Moraea inclinata, commonly known as the leaning moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
